com.phunware.alerts
Class PwAlertsSubscriptions

java.lang.Object
  com.phunware.alerts.PwAlertsSubscriptions

public final class PwAlertsSubscriptions
extends java.lang.Object

Use this to view and make changes to alert's subscription groups. Get a list of subscriptions from the server using getSubscriptionGroups(Context context). This will return an array list of PwSubscription objects. Each subscription will have a populated id and name field however the isSubscribed flag will be false.

The server maintains a subscription state however that state is not sent back in that call. It is up to the developer to maintain state of subscribed subscriptions locally. Either through SharedPreferences or an SQLiteDatabase, or another preferred method.

When the Alerts module is first installed (either a fresh install, or first time running with Alerts module) a call is made to register the device for push alerts and after a successful registration a call is made to un-subscribe from all subscriptions.

Method Detail

getSubscriptionGroups

public static java.util.ArrayList<PwSubscription> getSubscriptionGroups(android.content.Context context)
                                                                 throws com.phunware.core.exceptions.PwException
Get all available subscription groups from server. This will not include subscribed state for the subscriptions. This should be called outside of the UI thread.

Parameters:
context - A Context the application context
Returns:
an ArrayList of PwSubscription objects.
Throws:
com.phunware.core.exceptions.PwException - if there was a network error or if there is no internet connection

saveSubscriptions

public static void saveSubscriptions(android.content.Context context,
                                     java.util.List<PwSubscription> subscriptions)
                              throws com.phunware.core.exceptions.PwException
Call this to save subscription groups. Make sure to call this outside of the UI thread. This call will tell the server to wipe out the existing subscription settings and subscribe to the subscriptions in the given list.

Parameters:
context - A Context the application context
subscriptions - Subscription groups stored in the server will be replace by this subscriptions group.
Throws:
com.phunware.core.exceptions.PwException - if there is a network error or there is no internet.
